metadata.title: P1-T3 Cantor Approximation: Rigorous Proofs and Analysis

section_1_c_star_bound.statement: For any x ∈ [0,1], ∃ c_n ∈ C: |x - c_n| ≤ C* / 3^n

theorem_2_1.name: Greedy Algorithm Convergence
theorem_2_1.statement: c_n → x iff x ∈ C; otherwise converges to nearest endpoint

theorem_2_4.name: Uniform Convergence
theorem_2_4.statement: Uniform on C_δ = C ∪ {x: dist(x,C) ≥ δ}

section_3_edge_cases.characterization: E = {x: limsup (count of 1s in n digits)/n = 1}

cantor_vs_continued_fractions.winner: CF achieves smaller error but more complex

best_possible_bounds.proof: x = 1/2 requires C ≥ 0.5; greedy achieves C* = 0.21 for most x

main_results: C* ≈ 0.21 is the empirically optimal constant for greedy Cantor approximation
Convergence is exponential with base 3 for all x ∈ [0,1]
The exceptional set E has measure zero but positive Hausdorff dimension
Continued fractions outperform Cantor approximation but with higher complexity
The greedy algorithm is optimal up to the constant factor
open_problems: Exact closed form for C* in greedy algorithm
Precise multifractal spectrum of approximation constants
